label: Amazon WorkDocs
description:
Eclipse Tutorial - Unable to run project
Hi,I am new to the elastic cloud and am trying it out with a view to using it in forthcoming projects.  I started off going though the "Getting Started with Amazon EC2 Management in Eclipse" article (from the AWE Toolkit for Eclipse page).I created the application and it successfully runs from eclipse using a local Tomcat instance - no issues.  I then created the server exactly as in the tutorial (5 instances, no elastic ip, same security group (all zeros in each entry), ami-11ca2d78 etc).  The instances all start up and I am able to successfully secure shell into them.When I run the application on this Amazon cluster, I get a message in the Eclipse browser- "503 Service Unavailable - No server is available to handle this request".  I have tried several times yesterdayand today and still get this message.I also tried defining a single server (same AMI) in case it was the cluster going wrong.  When I do this I get a message "Navigation to the webpage was cancelled" - on refreshing the page as the browser suggests, I get a "This program cannot display the webpage".I spent much of yesterday and today playing with this and have been through some other tutorials, each of which defines a single serverand each time I get this set of messages.  There is no difference if I add an elastic IP either.  I have tried on US West and East coast with the same result.I am not sure if there is a step missing somewhere, but I am running the app fine locally and following the steps exactly.  My bill is rising and I have not had a single application.Can someone help me get this working please ?Thanks in advance !

label: Amazon WorkDocs
description:
Re: Eclipse Tutorial - Unable to run project
Hey srisom,

I'm not sure exactly what's happening, but maybe some of these ideas will help turn up a clue...

if you're having problems, simplifying is definitely a good idea.  It sounds like you've already tried with just a single EC2 Tomcat instance without an Elastic IP.  I'd stick with that to start off while you get everything figured out.

Make sure that you're right clicking on the servlet you want to run (whether in the editor or from the package explorer view) and selecting "run as..." -> "run on servier" then your EC2 Tomcat server.  Clicking directly on the project and selecting "run as..." -> "run on server" probably won't work because there isn't a default resource defined.

There might also be something in your network configuration causing problems.  If you have to go through a proxy server to get to the internet, you might have some problems using the Eclipse tools since they need to ssh to the EC2 hosts and configure everything.

Another problem I've run into is that port 8080 is blocked by some firewalls, so I have to change my Tomcat configuration to launch on port 80 instead (default is 8080 of course), and make sure that port is also open to CIDR IP 0.0.0.0/0 in your security group like you mentioned.

If you can ssh into the EC2 box, then you might try using curl or wget to hit "localhost:80" and see if you can access the server from there.  If so, then it seems likely to be a security group or network firewall/proxy issue.

Finally, don't forget to check the "Error Log" view in Eclipse to see if there are any clues in there.

hope that helps,
j

label: Amazon WorkDocs
description:
Re: Eclipse Tutorial - Unable to run project
Jason,Thank you so much for answering and giving some pointers.  I have been through the points and discovered that:1) Right clicking is ok.  I am doing that on the servlet - if I do this and choose my local Tomcat then it all works fine.2) Don't think I am going through a proxy - certainly the browsers have no entries and I have never had to put one in for anything - so this is unlikely.3) I logged on with ssh and from the server tried both curl and wget on localhost ports 80 and 8080.  Both tools failed ('couln't connect to host' from curl and 'Connection refused' from wget).4) I went into the Tomcat/conf directory on the server and swapped both references to 8080 in server.xml to 80, set JAVA_HOME to /env/jdk, ran the shutdown in the tomcat bin directory (this gave a connection refused error) and ran startup without error.  I hope this is correct to change the port.  After doing this I got the same messages from wget and curl.  I tried restarting the Tomcat server from the server view in Eclipse but it terminated the entire server and started a new one (so I lost my port 80 changes).My security group has all zeros set for ports 22,80,443 and 8080.  My local error log is completely empty.I am guessing that the issue is something to do with the connection failures etc on the server but am in the dark as to next steps.Can you offer any advice / suggestions ?Much appreciated !

label: Amazon WorkDocs
description:
Re: Eclipse Tutorial - Unable to run project
I have got a bit further on this.  I discovered by logging into the AMI and checking the processes, that Tomcat is not started.  Trying to start it (setting environment and doing a catalina start) causes a java stack trace.At this point I gave up on this AMI.  I have successfully deployed my app using the Java Web Apps in a Box AMI.  You cannot deploy directly from eclipse but you can export to a WAR file and load into tomcat with no issues.  I am going down that road unless the standard AMI gets sorted.Google 'Java development 2.0:Easy EC2' and follow the IBM step through.

label: Amazon WorkDocs
description:
Re: Eclipse Tutorial - Unable to run project
Hey srisom,I just checked out the IBM DeveloperWorks article you mentioned.  it looks like a great walkthrough for Eclipse/EC2/Java/Tomcat.  I'm glad you were able to get that setup working.I'm not sure why Tomcat wouldn't be starting up for you.  I'll see if we can reproduce that over here.  If you or others on the thread see this again, you can launch Eclipse from a command line with the "-debug -consoleLog" options, you should get debugging output in your terminal window from the toolkit that provides some clues as to what's happening when something goes wrong when Eclipse is launching the EC2 instances, pushing the application and starting Tomcat.  The output is fairly verbose, so feel free to private message it to me and I'd be happy to take a look and see if we can find any clues.

label: Amazon WorkDocs
description:
Re: Eclipse Tutorial - Unable to run project
Hey srisom,

very interesting that everything works from the browser, but not from Eclipse.  The internal Eclipse browser should be hitting the same URL, so I don't know what could be different.  You might check the URL inside Eclipse and see if it's trying to hit something different.  The error log view might also have something interesting if you haven't checked there yet for this issue.

glad this is at least working directly from a browser so that you have a decent workaround,
j

label: Amazon WorkDocs
description:
Re: Eclipse Tutorial - Unable to run project
A Solution!! (I think)

I had the exact same problem, everything working fine locally but could get nothing to run on AmazonEC2. I too noticed from the shell log for catalina.out that tomcat wasn't started.

A day and a half later...

I found the problem to be my server runtime environment in eclipse when you set up the server. It was set as Apache Tomcat V 6.0, of course, but I was using the latest version (6.0.24) and this seems to be the problem. I downloaded an older version from the Tomcat archive (6.0.18) and added this when configuring runtime environments. Setting up an instance with this server runtime environment works!

I hope this helps anyone who stumbles along here.
But why does 6.0.24 not work!!?? Can this be fixed?

label: Amazon WorkDocs
description:
Re: Eclipse Tutorial - Unable to run project
Hey Lemis,

We just released AWS Elastic Beanstalk last week (http://aws.amazon.com/elasticbeanstalk), which provides a really easy and highly configurable way to run Java web apps on AWS and have them automatically scale with load.

As part of that release, we did a big upgrade to the AWS Toolkit for Eclipse to support AWS Elastic Beanstalk.  We're still using all the same WTP tools in Eclipse, so your workflow shouldn't change much, but there is a new server type you can use: "AWS Elastic Beanstalk for Tomcat 6".

I'd definitely encourage you to try the new system; you should see much faster and more reliable performance now that AWS Elastic Beanstalk does all the heavy lifting.

There's a quick screencast showing the new Eclipse functionality here:
http://d1un85p0f2qstc.cloudfront.net/eclipse/elasticbeanstalk/index.html

and also a getting started guide for Eclipse here:
http://aws.amazon.com/articles/4412341514662386

Hope that helps!  Please try out the new tooling and let us know what you think.  It should be a big step up over the previous tooling in Eclipse,
j

label: Amazon WorkDocs
description:
Re: New S3 AWS Mgmt Console is loading and loading and loading...
Hi Chris,

The S3 Console uses flash to talk to the S3 servers. This has been the case since the S3 console was first released. Given that the iPad doesn't have flash support, the S3 Console would have never been accessible from the iPad. 

As regards the folks having trouble loading the console, would you please provide the ID of the diagnostic report generated by the console test page, and we will investigate.

For those in corporate environments, we are working on a way for you to access the console without making any firewall changes. We will update this thread when new information pertinent to your access issues is available. 

Thanks,
Manoj

label: Amazon WorkDocs
description:
Re: Problems logging into AWS Management Console
Hi, danedanedane,

I'm sorry for the trouble you're having accessing this service.

Approval for your Amazon EC2 account is still pending. This usually happens when we're unable to verify your credit card details. Please update your payment information by following these steps:

1. Go to http://aws.amazon.com
2. Click on Account > Payment Method.
3. If prompted, sign in with your AWS account e-mail address and password.
4. Click "Edit this card" to update the expiration date or billing address for your current payment method, or select or enter a different payment method.

You'll receive a confirmation e-mail when your account is approved.

I hope this helps. We look forward to seeing you again soon.

Best regards,
Matthew P.

In order for a service to become active we must validate the credit card on file for the account.  You received a notification that the card was unable to be verified which indicates that the service is not active.

For further assistance with account and billing issues please contact our customer service team directly, https://aws-portal.amazon.com/gp/aws/html-forms-controller/contactus/aws-account-and-billing

Michelle

label: Amazon WorkDocs
description:
Feedback on the Manamement Console
Hello,

I would like give you some Feedback on the AWS Management Console.

Bugs:

Instances: After launching a new instance the final "close" button in the dialog does not work. Only the closing button in the upper right corner works. After that, sometimes the "launch instance" button does not work any more.
Security Groups: It is not possible to add a new custom rule with protocol, port and group. Only predefined ones or custom but without group or custom with group but without specific protocol and port. The html form fields are always cleared by JavaScript.
Security Groups: When you add rule to group A, the switch to group B and then back to A it says "No records found."
Sometimes the navigation "AWS | Products | Developers ..." in the upper right corner shifts down to the tab "Amazon S3 | Amazon EC2 ...".
Account, Personal Information: The form does not work with special characters, e.g. München (Munich).


My browser is Chrome 7.

Apart from this it would be great to add multiple security groups to one instance.

First EC2 page after login: Not everyone is an American and using the default region. So why is it displayed always the first time? Even for people just using e.g. eu-west-1. It would be much better to see the actually used EC2 region first.

Best regards,
Bernd

Edited by: iblu on Nov 28, 2010 12:48 AM

label: Amazon WorkDocs
description:
Re: Feedback on the Manamement Console
Thanks for taking the time to give us feedback!  We will take a look and see what we can improve.

A couple things:

You can select any number of Security Groups in the Launch Instances Wizard (use cmd-click or alt-click on Security Groups).  

For custom Security Group rules, the Console only supports Group rules or protocol/port/cidr rules.
That is, if you specify another group in your rule, you are allowing instances in the target group full access to the instances in the allowing group.
Security Groups are a confusing topic, we hope to improve the UI for them in the future.

And finally, yes, the navigation (and other things) may compress in funny ways if the browser width is too narrow.

-Dave

label: Amazon WorkDocs
description:
Installing WorkDocs Companion on Microsoft Windows Server
Customers attempting to install Amazon WorkDocs Companion on Microsoft Windows Server may see their installation fail with an error message "The system administrator has set policies to prevent this installation". 

This is probably because of a software installation restriction policy in effect on Windows Servers. To enable the software install on Windows Server instances an Administrator has to set/create the "DisableMSI" registry key under HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Policies\Microsoft\Windows\Installer] and set its value to 0 ("DisableMSI"=dword:00000000).

label: Amazon WorkDocs

Hi Neil:

label: Amazon WorkDocs
description:
workdocs storage
My Storage used is much higher than the total of the files actually stored in that folder.  Because of this I am now over my included storage allowance.

Please see attached screenshots which just show one folder as an example.  However, this happens on the majority of folders in my workdocs.  If anyone has any ideas I would be very grateful.

label: Amazon WorkDocs
description:
Re: workdocs storage
Hello chris125163,

My name is MD. I'm the GM for WorkDocs application.

Thanks for reaching out to us and sorry for the inconvenience this issue may have caused. As you may know WorkDocs supports unlimited versions of a file. Although each version of a file may only be a few gigabytes, you can quickly consume all your allocated storage if you create many versions of the file. Storage quota is controlled and applied by your site administrator/s.

You have two options:
1. Easiest: if you so wish, you could contact your administrator (WorkDocs web application: Tasks > New Task > Contact Administrator) and request an addition to your storage quota.

2. If you do not wish to keep all the previous versions of the file, please follow these steps:

Download the file to your local machine to a temporary location.
Delete it from the WorkDocs folders (this releases all storage associated with the file).
Upload the file (from your temporary location) back into WorkDocs.
Lastly, and this important: Lock the file in WorkDocs. This will ensure that while updates are made the file and uploaded to the cloud, new versions are not created for each update.


Hope this helps. Apologies for the inconvenience once again.

Thanks,
MD.

I suspect what is happening is if there is a glitch in the connection when uploading, the file might start to upload again.  I suspect these partial files are being stored as file versions.  Because I am sending up large video files, these old, imcomplete files are using a lot of storage.

As you say I can delete them from work docs and send them again but it is more than likely that this same situation will occur.  Yesterday I uploaded 4 files totalling 54GB but the total showing in Workdocs is 93GB.

Is there anyway you are able to look at what these extra files using the storage are please?

label: Amazon WorkDocs
description:
Workdocs - security of sharing problem
Hi

I have setup WORKDOCS, and have a few users.
Each user has powerUser role, apart from myself, admin.

I've setup a shared folder from my drive, to be used for the company shared docs.

There is a hierarchy to the folders in this, and only parts are intended to be available to various levels/individuals.  
For example,
Company>HumanResources>Personnel>StaffOneName

In the folder StaffOneName, I have documents relating to that individual "StaffOne".
I gave contributor access to our HR manager at "HumanResources" folder level, so the HR manager can save and change documents. create new Personnel folders, and so on.
I gave the individual "StaffOne" view access on the folder containing his information, intending that this is all he could access.

In testing via Workdocs web access, I found that "StaffOne" can navigate to his folder "StaffOneName", but then clicking on the cookie trail links, he can navigate up a folder level to "Personnel", then see and navigate down into other staff folders, (eg "StaffTwoName" folder) and see other staff member details.

Considering that "StaffOne" has not been given any access to higher level or other folders in this hierarchy, nor inherited access to this, he should not be able to do this

This is a major security issue, or  I've missed something understanding how this is supposed to work?  
The documentation on sharing is accurate, but there's no security discussion in those docs, nor suggestion that what I have encountered is possible nor intended. Naturally, security being paramount, that this apparent 'reverse inheritance', should not be possible.

I would appreciate some direction/comment. As a newbie to WORKDOCS, happy for your 'guidance' to my possible misunderstanding or oversight of something.

thanks,
--geoff

Edited by: sanddweller on Jan 10, 2019 3:50 AM

label: Amazon WorkDocs
description:
Re: Workdocs - security of sharing problem
I am interested to hear AWS response on this

label: Amazon WorkDocs
description:
Re: Workdocs - security of sharing problem
Hello sanddweller@ 

Thanks for using WorkDocs and for providing feedback. From reading your scenario below it seems like you have most probably enabled sharing using link on the top level folder (Personnel or Human Resources  based on the structure you have outlined below: Company>HumanResources>Personnel>StaffOneName.

You can quickly cross check if this is the case by Selecting the Folder, Click on Share/Share a link and determine if Share a link has been turned on. If it has you can turn it off in the link access level section. 

Pls do let us know if this resolves your problem. 

Thanks and regards
manojn_aws

Thank you for being Amazon WorkDocs user and sorry to hear that you ran into an issue.
We are looking at the detail you provided to address the issue.

Meanwhile, you can do following manual step to update the configuration on your machine to unblock.

4. Start WorkDocs Drive

This should delete the files from the local drive and it appears to do that.  But it really moves the folders under a .renamed folder.  This is an issue because the files are quite large and need to be removed from the local system.

Is there a way to force a cleanup cleanup job to start or are the files under the .renamed folder removed after a specific period of time?

label: Amazon WorkDocs
description:
Re: .rename folder holding large amount of data
Hi andrewlivingston:

Files would be moved under .rename folder for several reasons ( i.e. files with not allowed characters, trying to upload files to a folder where user doesn't have required permissions etc..)

Here is the suggested for your scenario,
1. Please make a copy of your files/media files on local machine.
2. Uninstall Sync client and remove all folders related to WorkDocs Sync client.
3. Ensure file names doesn't have any excluded items: https://docs.aws.amazon.com/workdocs/latest/userguide/sync_client_help.html#sync_excluded_files 
4. Install WorkDocs Drive on your machine. Create a new folder where you want the files to be uploaded and copy from local device to this new folder.

Thanks

label: Amazon WorkDocs
description:
Re: Workdocs Sync Running..
Hello:

"On coming home i created two folders onto home laptop and installed sync and mapped to these folders"

We need to understand what particular actions where taken to "map the folders". There is no functionality in WorkDocs Sync client to map to 2 different folder. At any given time, Sync application can be configured to have one folder that will sync everything including 2 sub-folders that you have with WorkDocs.

As suggested previously, Please install WorkDocs Drive application from https://amazonworkdocs.com/apps.html on your home machine, and you will be unblocked to access all the content of WorkDocs on your home machine.

Thanks

Hello,

Engineering has suggested that you whitelist the following:

    zocalo.ap-northeast-1.amazonaws.com
    zocalo.ap-southeast-2.amazonaws.com
    zocalo.eu-west-1.amazonaws.com
    zocalo.eu-central-1.amazonaws.com
    zocalo.us-east-1.amazonaws.com
    zocalo.us-gov-west-1.amazonaws.com
    zocalo.us-west-2.amazonaws.com
    awsapps.com
    amazonaws.com
    cloudfront.net
    aws.amazon.com
    amazonworkdocs.com 

Proxy support is on our roadmap for the future. 

Richard

The one that happened in front of me happened after attempting to load WorkDocs Drive (which wouldn't open the first 3 or 4 times I tried).  Waiting some time between.  Finally the WorkDocs Drive login screen opened up but right before it did that my taskbar disappeared and all of my icons on the desktop.  This has happened on two different WorkSpaces and one Windows 7 computer in the office.

Is WorkDocs Drive not playing well with Windows Explorer?

Ian

label: Amazon WorkDocs
description:
Re: WorkDocs Drive causing desktop icons and taskbar to disappear?
Hi Ian:

WorkDocs Drive provides an integrated experience with Windows File Explorer via visual icons on files/folders to show the status of files as well as right-click context menu for quick actions on the files.

When a new version of WorkDocs Drive is released and updated for the users, for above experience to work, Windows Explorer process is restarted. During the update process, user might momentarily see taskbar/icons disappearing and reappearing.

We are looking to improve this user experience during the update.
I will follow-up with you on email thread we are having to collection additional information.

Thanks

Edited by: aws-hrshah on Jun 5, 2018 10:49 PM

label: Amazon WorkDocs
description:
Re: WorkDocs Drive causing desktop icons and taskbar to disappear?

Just to clarify, when I say they disappear I don't mean they blink and come back... although I have seen that happen (which was my first indicator it may be WorkDocs doing this to us).  In the three cases recently the icons and taskbar do not come back at all.  But as a follow up to that, I forgot to mention that on the one that happened while I was using the computer (opening WorkDocs), when I brought up the Task Manager there was no explorer.exe running on it.  So I just started a new explorer.exe and my icons and taskbar all came back.  So something with WorkDocs trying to restart explorer is not working right -- it's killing explorer.exe but not actually reloading it in some cases.

Ian

description:
Re: Dealing with long file paths
Hi Mike:

Thank you for being customer of Amazon WorkDocs and using WorkDocs Drive. All WorkDocs applications supports file path name upto 260 characters. 

It appears that you have large amount of data (136 GB) that you are looking to migrate to WorkDocs and that you have file path lengths exceeding 260 char. To provide appropriate guidance for your scenario and assess if it is supported, we need to understand source of your files, folder structure, planned data migration among several things.

Please reach out to HRSHAH AT AMAZON DOT COM with details on your scenario and we can assist further.

Thanks

label: Amazon WorkDocs
description:
Document Properties Search? Bespoke options?
Hi, I'm evaluating WorkDocs with a view to migrating a client from a different document management system. While what WorkDocs does, it seems to do very well, it is very weak on its searching capabilities. For example: 

document content search is not supported and 
the documentation is poor, so I don't even know if AND, OR searching is permitted.


If WorkDocs is to be taken seriously the searching needs to be improved. 

MS Office Document Properties Search?
But what is really killing this opportunity is the lack of document properties searching. My client extensively tags documents using MS Office properties, and their current solution allows filtering, sorting, and searching on these. Without at least a properties search capability WorkDocs is not a viable solution. 

I get that it doesn't do this out-of-the-box, but I've looked at the SDK, at ElasticSearch, ... and I can't even see how I'd bespoke this within AWS. Anyone got any ideas?

Thanks
Pete

label: Amazon WorkDocs
description:
Re: Document Properties Search? Bespoke options?
Hello Pete -

Thanks for reaching out.

I'm MD, Sr. Manager, Engineering in the WorkDocs team. This is a very timely post. We are in the process of launching a SmartSearch functionality even as we speak. Note that the feature is already generally available and you should be able to access it from the Search bar when you sign into the web application. SmartSearch also supports searching for Labels and several other document properties.

That said, I would like to take a moment and discuss a few of these items with you. I will send you a private message to check if we can perhaps schedule a call to discuss.

Thanks,
MD.

label: Amazon WorkDocs
description:
Location of new WorkDocs Drive on disk
Hi,
I was using the old WorkDocs and it's location on disk was C:\Users\akiyano\WorkDocs.
If I wanted to access it via WSL I could go to /mnt/c/Users/akiyano/WorkDocs/.

Now there is the new WorkDocs Drive that adds a W:\ drive and now the WorkDocs path is W:\My Documents.

A few questions about this:
1. It seems that these are 2 separate locations on the disk and the WorkDocs client syncs between them. So does this mean WorkDocs now takes twice as much place? If so how do I avoid this?
2. I want to continue using WorkDocs in WSL but the only drive WSL sees is C:\ how do I access W:\?

Thanks,
Arthur

label: Amazon WorkDocs
description:
Re: Location of new WorkDocs Drive on disk
G'day Arthur,

The new WorkDocs Drive client, which has replaced the older sync client, presents the 'W:' drive volume as a network mounted drive. On Windows 10 under the Windows Subsystem for Linux network drives will need to be explicitly mounted before they're available.

You should be able to execute the following commands from your WSL bash prompt when you have WorkDocs Drive mounted and running:
$ sudo mkdir /mnt/w
$ sudo mount -t drvfs W: w
$ cd /mnt/w
$ ls

Here's the copy/paste of my command line entries and output in WSL bash:
streetp@******:/mnt$ sudo mkdir /mnt/w
streetp@******:/mnt$ sudo mount -t drvfs W: /mnt/w
streetp@******:/mnt$ cd /mnt/w
streetp@******:/mnt/w$ ls
My Documents  Shared With Me
streetp@******:/mnt/w$ ls -la
total 0
drwxrwxrwx 1 root root 512 Dec 31  1979 .
drwxr-xr-x 1 root root 512 Sep  5 11:07 ..
drwxrwxrwx 1 root root 512 Jun 29 18:22 My Documents
drwxrwxrwx 1 root root 512 Jul 11 15:36 Shared With Me

You can find more info related to improvements to WSL filesystem mounting here at Microsoft's site:
https://blogs.msdn.microsoft.com/wsl/2017/04/18/file-system-improvements-to-the-windows-subsystem-for-linux/

Please let me know if that works!

Cheers,
Phil S.
